required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Two is Better Than One: A Novel Venous Access System for Intermittent Apheresis
clinical_study.official_title: Two is Better Than One: A Novel Venous Access System for Intermittent Apheresis

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose: To describe a novel configuration of venous access for the performance of intermittent apheresis.
Participants: 20 participants at UNC who were referred for change from a vortex port to a powerflow port.
Procedures (methods): Placement of one of two configurations of the powerflow port and follow up visits between January 1, 2019 and December 31, 2023.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year following new port configuration placement
primary_outcome.description: The study will compare mean change flow rate for pheresis sessions with the old system versus pheresis sessions with one of two new configurations by averaging the flow rate for up to 5 sessions using the new port configuration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year following new port configuration placement
primary_outcome.description: The study will compare mean change in procedure time for pheresis sessions with the old system versus pheresis sessions with one of two new configurations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Use of Tissue Plasminogen Activator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year following new port configuration placement
secondary_outcome.description: The study will compare mean change in use of tissue plasminogen activator for pheresis sessions with the old system versus pheresis sessions with one of two new configurations.

arm_group.description: This study will involve a chart review of patients at UNC who were referred for change from a vortex port to a powerflow port.

intervention.description: The study will compare pheresis sessions with the old system versus pheresis sessions with one of two new configurations.

study_pop.textblock: A total of 20 adults will be enrolled to this study. The study subjects will be recruited from adults who are scheduled to receive or have received a PowerFlowâ„¢ Implantable Apheresis IV Port in Vascular Interventional Radiology for their clinical care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over the age of 18 years of age.
- Referred for change from a vortex port to a powerflow port.
- Previously placed or scheduled placement of one of two configurations of the PowerFlow port
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to read and understand English.
- Unable to provide informed consent.

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified individual data that supports the results will be shared beginning 9 to 36 months following publication provided the investigator who proposes to use the data has approval from an Institutional Review Board (IRB), Independent Ethics Committee (IEC), or Research Ethics Board (REB), as applicable, and executes a data use/sharing agreement with UNC.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The investigator who proposes to use the data has received IRB, IEC, or REB approval, as applicable, and an executed data use/sharing agreement with UNC.
